pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Thanks! Looks a bit silly, but there are other autogenerated instance names in this file, and they get turned into links, so it's probably fine.

maintainer merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6404553766/job/17385352631)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6404553766/job/17385352382)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6404553766/job/17385353087)

I think that we shouldn't explicitly reference auto-generated names. I know this has happened before, but just like with auto-generated variable names, it's not the most reliable thing to do.
And in this case the name is also ridiculously long. So please give the instance an explicit name like `NumberField.RingOfIntegers.FintypeClassGroup`. After that, please merge.

bors d+

I think that we shouldn't explicitly reference auto-generated names. I know this has happened before, but just like with auto-generated variable names, it's not the most reliable thing to do.
And in this case the name is also ridiculously long. So please give the instance an explicit name like `NumberField.RingOfIntegers.FintypeClassGroup`. After that, please merge.

bors d+
Hmm, I would much prefer that we rename this celebrated result to something a bit more readable. Would you mind doing that in this same PR?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc: add an algebraic number theory section to Mathlib overview

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add a Module.Finite instance for units of number field

nodes.body:
Thanks! Looks a bit silly, but there are other autogenerated instance names in this file, and they get turned into links, so it's probably fine.

maintainer merge
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by tb65536.

I think that we shouldn't explicitly reference auto-generated names. I know this has happened before, but just like with auto-generated variable names, it's not the most reliable thing to do.
And in this case the name is also ridiculously long. So please give the instance an explicit name like `NumberField.RingOfIntegers.FintypeClassGroup`. After that, please merge.

bors d+
